subject: Re: [junit] Re: HOW TO ASK QUESTIONS ON THIS GROUP - FAQ   proposal
msgSnippet: Hi I can add JUnit Framework Architecture section. This section contains explaination and pointers to crtical design patterns used(Command,Composite,paramter
messageBody:
Hi
I can add JUnit Framework Architecture section.
This section contains explaination and pointers to
crtical design patterns
used(Command,Composite,paramter collecting)....

I am having couple slides which i created and used for
my presentation.

Venky

--- Jim Cheesman <jchees@...> wrote:
> Version 0.0.2. (Or something like that ;)
>
> Volunteers for sections?
>
> Jim
>
>
> JUnit (mailing list) FAQ:
>
> 1 The Basics
> 1.1 What is JUnit?
> 1.2 What is unit testing? Functional testing?
> Black/white box testing?
> 1.3 Where do I find documentation?
> 1.4 How do I report bugs? [+ sample ]
> 1.5 How do I get help? [+ mailing list archives,
> mailing list ]
> 1.6 Other resources (major sites/articles)
>
> 2 Installation
> 2.1 What do I need?
> 2.2 Where can I get it?
> 2.3 IDE Integration
> 2.3.1 ant
> 2.3.2 Netbeans
> 2.3.3 VAJ
> 2.3.4 ???
>
> 3 How do I test...
> 3.1 public variables and functions?
> 3.2 "friendly"/protected variables and functions?
> 3.3 private variables/functions?
> 3.4 servlets/jsps?
> 3.5 ejb's?
> 3.6 interfaces
> 3.7 Database operations (JDBC)
>
> 4 Misc.
> 4.1 What are mock objects?
> 4.2 Where can I get more information?
> 4.3 What is extreme programming? "Test first"
> programming?
> 4.4 Are there any equivalents for other languages?
>
> --
>
> * Jim Cheesman *
